commitResults.messageTitle: Initial commit to implement Level-0 bot
commitResults.messageBody:
- Removed Duke and created MeeBot
- Implement greet and exit

commitResults.messageTitle: Level 1: Add echo and bye functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added echo functionality to repeat user inputs
- Implemented bye command to gracefully exit
- Enhanced CLI output formatting with right-aligned and word-wrapping
- Established architecture separating UI, Renderer and Messages
- Updated ASCII art logo for MeeBot

commitResults.messageTitle: Code cleanup and CLI improvements - Remove unused Message implementation to clean up codebase - Improve CLI output formatting for better readability and consistency

Level-2: Implement Task and TaskManager with add/list support - Implement Task and TaskManager classes to encapsulate task data and operations - Add AddTaskMessage to confirm task additions - Add TaskListMessage to display numbered task list - Update Main loop and UI to handle 'task' (add) and 'list' commands
Add explanatory comments and documentation to core classes

commitResults.messageBody: Users can mark tasks as done with command `mark N` and unmark with command `unmark N`.

commitResults.messageTitle: Level-4: Implement task inheritance with Todo, Deadline, Event classes
commitResults.messageBody:
- Convert Task to abstract base class with polymorphic storage
- Add type-specific icons and command parsing for todo/deadline/event
- Support deadline (/by) and event (/from) syntax
- Add task count feedback in TaskAddedMessage

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor command handling into CommandProcessor and Command subclasses
commitResults.messageBody:
Extracts parsing and execution logic from main loop into a centralized CommandProcessor.
Each task operation now has its own Command class, handling validation and returning Messages.
This simplifies the main loop and improves separation of concerns between main, UI flow and command logic.

Implemented the `delete N` command to allow users to remove tasks, including
comprehensive input validation and error handling for invalid task numbers.
Added the `DeleteTaskCmd` and `TaskDeletedMessage` classes to provide clear
confirmation feedback showing details of the removed task.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(message): rename message classes for clarity
commitResults.messageBody:
Renamed message classes (e.g., AddTaskMessage -> TaskAddedMessage)
to make their purpose clearer and maintain consistent naming conventions.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(error): add centralized handling with MeeBot personality
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce ErrorMessage class to consolidate scattered error strings
into centralized constants. Add validation for invalid formats and
boundary conditions, ensuring more comprehensive error handling.

Enhance error messages with specific guidance while maintaining
MeeBot's Singaporean personality to provide a consistent user
experience.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: Use enum for command types
commitResults.messageBody:
Consolidated command keyword, help text, and factory functions into a
single enum definition to keep all command metadata co-located for better
maintainability. This eliminates switch-case command object creation by
embedding command creation logic directly in CommandType enum.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(command): add help command for MeeBot
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce a HELP command that lists all available commands along
with their usage format. The implementation leverages metadata
defined in CommandType to ensure help text stays consistent with
actual command behaviour.

This improves usability by providing built-in guidance, allowing
users to discover supported actions without needing external
documentation.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: refine Javadocs for Task and Message classes
chore: remove unused imports and methods from refactor
